note.p: Death: His house in Chester Terrace, Regent's Park, London (15 October 1859)

Career: Storekeeper, Royal Clarence Victualling Yard, Portsmouth (1820); invented steam machinery for making biscuit (1829); patented the manufacture of briquettes for fuel (1840); devised a method for distilling drinking water from sea water; Comptroller of Victualling and Transport Services (1851); retired due to ill health (1858)
Notes: Baptised 27 March 1795, St Mary's Church, Portsea
